alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:18AM CST until January 26 at 10:48PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Peach Creek at Splendora. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as a residential yard on the upstream left bank begins to take on water and Goodson Road beginsto take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Thursday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.7 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 02/26/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Peach Creek Splendora 14.0 15.3 Thu 10 am CS 14.3 10.1 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.late tonight at 430 AM CST.
